We based our model on the age- and sex-structured population dynamic model of a plains zebra population in Laikipia District, Kenya, developed by Georgiadis et al. [ 16]. Briefly, the model adjusts vital rates and age at first reproduction through a rainfall-mediated density-dependent (RMDD) mechanism. This RMDD modulates vital rates by a factor that depends on the ratio of carrying capacity K
y to population size N
H . Here, the carrying capacity is defined as the maximum number of individuals that could be supported in a given year, at maximum reproductive output and was estimated as a function of the total rainfall ( R
y , in mm) recorded in the location of interest over an entire year y such as
